name: aci_memory_manifest
purpose: Declare canonical memory schema + ownership. Enforce that system-wide exports and validators are owned by HiveMind while allowing entity-local schemas under entities/*/schemas/

entity_level.note: Entity-local schemas may be used only by tools scoped to that entity. They cannot be referenced by hivemind global migrators unless explicitly promoted.

migration_control.transition_rule: tools referencing entity-level migration must be redirected to hivemind.migrate_to_jsonl before entity migrators are deleted

notes: This manifest declares HiveMind as the canonical authority for system-wide memory exports and JSONL migration. Keep AGI-specific schemas and tools under entities/agi/ and mark them local_only. In case of an emergency, ALIAS/TVA/Sentinel can promote an entity schema to system-level via an explicit signed operation. Legacy exports remain valid but must be upgraded with entity_uid before distribution. Identity memory manifests now reside under aci://memory/identity/<identity_path>/ to centralize governance. $meta.sha256 entries here and in subordinate manifests encode the sha256 digest of the Base58 ArtifactID, not a file checksum, ensuring relocations do not spur false integrity alarms.
Linked memory exports to the entity registry UID field for future mappings.
Documented entity_uid requirement while allowing legacy artifacts for migrators.
Consolidated per-entity memory manifests into aci://memory/identity/ hierarchy.
Updated documentation references to point at the centralized memory namespace.

entity_binding.notes: Each memory export header.entity_uid must match the owning entity UID; legacy exports remain available for migration.
